trans-unit.source: Matomo (formerly Piwik) settings
Enable Matomo tracking
Adds the Matomo javascript tag to the site.
Ignore members
Don´t track members who are logged into the Contao frontend.
Ignore users
Don´t track users who are logged into the Contao backend.
URL of the Matomo installation
The absolute URL to Matomo installation (with http(s)://).
Site ID
The ID of the website created in Matomo.
Use the page title
Use the page title (Meta information) instead of the page name.
Add the domain name
Add the domain name to the page title (domain/pagetitle).
Map the site structure
Add the site structure to the page title (rootpage/parentpage/pagetitle).
Add site language (as Custom Variable)
Adds a custom variable with the name 'Language' and the current page language as value.
Add member name (as Custom Variable)
Adds a custom variable with the name 'User' and the name of the logged in user or 'Anonymous' for visitors as value.
React to 'Do Not Track' request
Respect if visitor do not wish to be tracked.
Track visitors across all subdomains
Tracks visitors as unique if they visit multiple subdomains (e.g. a.domain.tld and b.domain.tld).
Local Domains
A comma separated list of Domains that are treated as local Domains (Links to these domains will not tracked as Outlinks).
Include all Subdomains as local
Treat all Subdomains as local Domains (Links to subdomains will not tracked as Outlinks).
Show reference to 404 Page not found seperate
You have the possibility to show references to 404 Page not found in the matomo statistic seperate. So you can find "dead links" easier.
Track all content impressions

You can enable to track piece of content (e.g. advertising). Mark each content block with a [data-track-content] HTML attribute or [matomoTrackContent] CSS class. View Matomo Documentation about content tracking.
Track visible content impressions
This is mainly the same as "Track all content impression" but it will only track visible content blocks or when they become visible (e.g. when they in in the viewport after scrolling down).
Download extensions
List of file extensions that will be tracked as a download.
Custom variable name
Enter the name for the custom variable with the scope 'visit'.
Custom variable value
Enter a value for the custom variable (with "+ javascript command +" you can add javascript variables e.g. "+document.domain+").
Add custom variable
Adds a custom variable defined by yourself.
Custom variable name
Enter the name for the custom variable with the scope 'page'.
Custom variable value
Enter a value for the custom variable (with "+ javascript command +" you can add javascript variables e.g. "+document.domain+").
